com.quest.glue.api.services
Interface TopologyDataSubmissionService3.TopologySubmitter3

Enclosing interface:
TopologyDataSubmissionService3
public static interface TopologyDataSubmissionService3.TopologySubmitter3

This interface is used to submit the actual data. Data must be associated with a specific host so when this interface is obtained from either TopologyDataSubmissionService3.getTopologySubmitter().

This class is not thread safe. If an agent will be submitting data from multiple threads, each thread must use a distinct instance of TopologySubmitter3 (allocated by TopologyDataSubmissionService3.getTopologySubmitter()) or must use a synchronization method that ensures that the TopologySubmitter3 is not modified by different threads at the same time.

Field Detail

AGENT_ID_PLACEHOLDER

static final java.lang.String AGENT_ID_PLACEHOLDER
This special value is use when submitting Agent topology objects.

The Agent topology definition lists the "agentID" attribute as an identity property, which means that it must be submitted by the client. However, the numeric ID for an agent is only know to the server (and can change if the server is restarted). To support this, the FglAM adapter will replace any value with this name by changing the value name to "agentID" and providing the numeric agent ID when submitting the value to the CDT. The code generated by the dev. kit uses this place holder.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Method Detail

createTopLevelNode

TopologyNode createTopLevelNode(java.lang.String name,
                                long defaultSampleFrequency)
Creates a new top level node, with the provided name and frequency. This node will be added to the list returned by getTopLevelNodes().

The node tree is maintained (even after data is submitted). This allows you to build up the node/metric tree just once and then update the values as needed without recreating the tree each time.

If you plan on having submitting more than one topology tree, it would be better to create multiple submitters, each with a different set of top level nodes, rather than re-using the same submitter with a different top level node.

Parameters:
name - The name of the top level node
defaultSampleFrequency - The rate that will be reported to the server for sample frequency. This can be overridden for child nodes or values. A child node or value that does not define a frequency will inherit their parent's frequency. This value is in milliseconds. The top level node must have a frequency. Use zero to indicate data submitted out-of-band. That is, not at the regularly scheduled interval.
Returns:
A top level node to which other nodes and values are to be attached.

flushPendingMessages

void flushPendingMessages()
                          throws SubmittingTooFrequentlyUnsupportedException
Flushes all submitted data to the comm. layer, without waiting for the next designated polling interval. This method should not be used unless there is a specific need to send pending data to the server as quickly as possible. Regular data submission in particular should not call this method.

There is a maximum rate at which this method can be called. If that rate is exceeded then a SubmittingTooFrequentlyUnsupportedException will be thrown and the data will not be flushed. Although it might be tempting to reverse engineer the maximum rate and call this as quickly as possible, don't. The value is a global setting applied to all outgoing connections. If there is another agent is deployed on this system that also calls flushPendingMessages() then this method will almost certainly break unexpectedly.

Throws:
SubmittingTooFrequentlyUnsupportedException - This method has been called too frequently and risks overloading the FMS. The flush was not performed and the data will be submitted according to the default schedule.

getMetaData

java.lang.String getMetaData(java.lang.String key)
Obtain the vale of a specific meta data key associated with this submission.

Developers will not normally need to use this method and are encouraged to use one of the other type-safe methods for getting meta data. Meta data is not persisted between submission if the same submitter is used for multiple submissions.

Parameters:
key - The key describing this meta data
Returns:
The value associated with the meta data key or null if there is no value.

getPriority

TopologySubmissionPriority getPriority()
Gets the priority currently being used by this topology submitter.

Returns:
The priority currently associated with the submitter and its data.
See Also:
setPriority(TopologySubmissionPriority)

getTopLevelNodes

java.util.List<? extends TopologyNode> getTopLevelNodes()
Returns the list of nodes at the top-level of the topology tree. If no nodes have yet been created by createTopLevelNode(String, long), then an empty list is returned.

Returns:
A list containing all the current top level nodes for this submitter.

isHistorical

boolean isHistorical()
Whether or not the data submitter is sending historical data.

Returns:
true if the data is historical and false if it is not.
See Also:
setHistoricalData(boolean)

setHistoricalData

void setHistoricalData(boolean is_historical)
Indicates whether or not the data submission contains historical data. This could be data parsed out of older log files and which falls outside of the normal sample period. The upstream server will handle data submissions which contain historical data using different rules, alarms will not be triggered for example.

The default, if not specified, is false and will not persist between submissions if the same submitter is used for multiple submissions.

Parameters:
is_historical - Whether or not this submission contains historical data.
See Also:
isHistorical()

setMetaData

void setMetaData(java.lang.String key,
                 java.lang.String value)
Sets a meta data field that will be associated with this submission.

Developers will not normally need to use this method and are encouraged to use one of the other type-safe methods for setting meta data. Meta data is not persisted between submission if the same submitter is used for multiple submissions.

Parameters:
key - The key describing this meta data
value - The value associated with this meta data.

setPriority

void setPriority(TopologySubmissionPriority priority)
Sets the priority associated with this topology submission. The priority will not persist between submissions if the same submitter is used for multiple submissions.

The default, if not set explicitly, is TopologySubmissionPriority.NORMAL.

TopologySubmissionPriority.LOW and TopologySubmissionPriority.NORMAL data is not guaranteed to be submitted to the upstream server. If can be dropped if connection to the server is unavailable for an extended period of time or if the upstream server need to drop data submission because it is overloaded.

Parameters:
priority - The priority to be associated with this submission.
See Also:
getPriority()

setTopologyFormat

void setTopologyFormat(java.lang.String format)
Sets the format of the topology tree contained in this submitted. The default, if not set, is "raw". In raw mode, the FglAM adapter installed on the FMS will not do any translation or interpretation of the nodes. It will pass them to the CDT exactly as it receives them.

You should not need to call this method.

Raw mode data submission is intended to be used when the developer is managing both the CDT and the topology tree that is transmitted to the server.

In particular, raw mode ignores all attributes on the node except the name, timestamp, and frequency. Should this submitter be passed to classes generated by the Foglight Developer's Kit, it will automatically be set to non-raw mode. The topology tree built up by the generated classes requires that the adapter perform some translations on the tree before it is submitted to the CDT.

Parameters:
format - The format for the topology tree.

submit

void submit()
            throws TopologyException
Submits the current node/value tree to the server using the current time as the timestamp on the top level node.

Throws:
TopologyException - If the data could not be submitted. Causes could include incorrectly structured data or TopologySubmissionPriority.HIGH priority data which could not be accepted due to a cache overflow.

submit

void submit(long timestamp)
            throws TopologyException
Submits the current node/value tree to the server.

After submission, the node tree is discarded from the submitter

Parameters:
timestamp - Timestamp for the metrics in milliseconds since the Epoch. This must be in local machine time and will be adjusted to compensate for time drift between the client and the server. Nodes and Values can override this timestamp on an individual basis. A Node or Value that does not define a timestamp will inherit their parent's timestamp.
Throws:
TopologyException - If the data could not be submitted. Causes could include incorrectly structured data or TopologySubmissionPriority.HIGH priority data which could not be accepted due to a cache overflow.

submitVerified

TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3 submitVerified()
                                                                  throws TopologyException
Submits the current node/value tree to the server, returning a tracker than can be used to verify reception of the data and request retransmission if necessary.

Verified submissions will automatically be set to TopologySubmissionPriority.HIGH priority and can be tracked using the returned object. If a verified submission fails or is dropped, the exact same data can and should be resubmitted using the returned object.

Note: The data associated with verified submission is cached in the returned TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3 object, to allow for retransmission attempts. If a large number of verified submissions occur simultaneously, this can significantly increase the memory usage of FglAM.

Returns:
A status tracker that can be used to query for the current status of the transmission attempt and to request re-transmission of the data if needed.
Throws:
TopologyException - If the data could not be submitted. Possible causes include the server being overloaded, invalid or incorrect data, or no data at all. A TopologyException may also be generated if the agent is submitting verified data too frequently.

submitVerified

TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3 submitVerified(long timestamp)
                                                                  throws TopologyException
Submits the current node/value tree to the server, returning a tracker than can be used to verify reception of the data and request retransmission if necessary.

Verified submissions will automatically be set to TopologySubmissionPriority.HIGH priority and can be tracked using the returned object. If a verified submission fails or is dropped, the exact same data can and should be resubmitted using the returned object.

Note: The data associated with verified submission is cached in the returned TopologyDataSubmissionService3.VerifiedSubmission3 object, to allow for retransmission attempts. If a large number of verified submissions occur simultaneously, this can significantly increase the memory usage of FglAM.

Parameters:
timestamp - Timestamp for the metrics in milliseconds since the Epoch. This must be in local machine time and will be adjusted to compensate for time drift between the client and the server. Nodes and Values can override this timestamp on an individual basis. A Node or Value that does not define a timestamp will inherit their parent's timestamp.
Returns:
A status tracker that can be used to query for the current status of the transmission attempt and to request re-transmission of the data if needed.
Throws:
TopologyException - If the data could not be submitted. Possible causes include the server being overloaded, invalid or incorrect data, or no data at all. A TopologyException may also be generated if the agent is submitting verified data too frequently.
